intro: Streptanthus tehuelches, commonly known as the Tehuelche crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments and has a compact, cushion-like growth form. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Streptanthus tehuelches is adapted to harsh, cold climates and plays a role in the alpine ecosystems of its native range.
